IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: St. Joseph's Center Foundation was founded by certain officers of the Congregation of Sisters, Servants of the Immaculate Heart of Mary, Scranton, PA. It was formed to solicit, collect, hold, or distribute property, real or otherwise, for the benefit of St. Joseph's Center, a non-profit institution, also founded by the Congregation.
IRS990.MissionDescription: St. Joseph's Center Foundation was founded by certain officers of the Congregation of Sisters, Servants of the Immaculate Heart of Mary, Scranton, PA. It was formed to solicit, collect, hold, or distribute property, real or otherwise, for the benefit of St. Joseph's Center, a non-profit institution, also founded by the Congregation.
IRS990.Description: Contributions made to St. Joseph's Center Capital Improvement fund for the purchase of various capital items and improvements.

Activity2.Description: Contributions made to St. Joseph's Center for operating expenses.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Foundation maintains 3 separate endowment funds. The first is the Lunney Endowment. It was created via a bequest to St. Joseph's Children's and Maternity Hospital and is used for the needs of the children of St. Joseph's Center. The second is the Weinberg Endowment and assists with the maintenance and upkeep of the St. Joseph's Center Pool Therapy Building. The third is the Foundation Endowment created as a result of an endowment campaign conducted by St. Joseph's Center Foundation in 2000 in which the proceeds from this campaign are to be permanently invested for the benefit of St. Joseph's Center.
Net assets released from restrictions $113,517; Fundraising Expense $50,751; Decrease in temporarily restricted net assets $93,755

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: The $148,000 represents contributions to St. Joseph's Center for operating expenses and capital item purchases.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: The funds transferred from St. Joseph's Center Foundation to St. Joseph's Center are for operating expenses and are not grants.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is prepared by an accountant of St. Joseph's Center. It is reviewed by St. Joseph's Center's accounting manager, St. Joseph's Center's CFO, and an outside accounting firm before it is filed.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: St. Joseph's Center Foundation makes its governing documents and financial statements available to the public through the Form 990 and upon request.

Schedule R Part II (Line B): The primary activity of St. Joseph's Center is to provide rehabilitation and developmental services in various institutional and community-based settings to individuals who are physically and emotionally impaired-to foster the welfare of the individuals and their families in any appropriate manner.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Please see Schedule O for details
